page.title: 06WOOLHOPE ECOLOGY (2)
page.content:
{Nature Reserves Wessington Pasture (Herefordshire & Radnorshire Nature Trust) is 27 acres of upland pasture & mixed woodland which has a varied flora, a rookery & other birds including the three British woodpeckers. It is a good place for fungi in the autumn. Sharpnage Wood contains a Site of Special Scientific Interest.
{Footpaths }Several paths shown as rights of way on the current O.S. 1/25000 sheet are either obstructed or impossible to find. In September 1985 the Ramblers' Association complained that the Marcle Ridge footpath was obstructed in various places by barbed wire, ploughing & growing crops.
